items.title: Indian insurers seek zero-coupon bonds to manage long-term risks
items.description: Zero-coupon bonds could help insurance companies better manage their long-term liabilities, as they step up offerings of guaranteed savings products

items.title: EaseMy Trip – why this journey may be challenging for investors
items.description: Company steadily losing market share and the financial performance reflects the stress

items.title: Quick Take: Proposed GST hike on apparel to hurt consumer sentiment
items.description: The rate increase could translate into a 5-6 percent rise in mid-to-premium apparel prices.

items.title: Intel's ousted CEO Pat Gelsinger to receive up to $12 million payout
items.description: The board told Gelsinger he could retire or be removed, and he chose to step down, Reuters reported.

items.title: IFBA 2023: Healthcare, precision manufacturing key focus areas for family offices, say experts
items.description: India’s family offices are embracing private markets and diversification as part of a broader shift in investment strategies

items.title: Manoj Kolhatkar appointed MD and CEO of Tata AutoComp Systems
items.description: As we navigate an exciting phase of expansion and diversification, Manoj’s strategic acumen and commitment to excellence will undoubtedly propel us to new heights,” said Arvind Goel, Chairman, Tata AutoComp Systems Ltd.

items.title: Family businesses crucial for economic growth, says Sunil Kant Munjal
items.description: Sunil Kant Munjal noted that family offices are now a significant source of funding for startups and early-stage companies.
